In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girld in Est Harles can read magazines and books that celbrate black and brown culture and heritage

The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like tea

---

In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving the

In your opinion, what are the most important things students should learn in school? What is the most important thing you have learned in school? How has this knowledge affected your life? How do you think it will help your success in the future?

---

In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots:L it may work, but does not ignite either  the p[assi

In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Stud

In your opinion, what are the most important things students should learn in school? What is the most important thing you have learned in school? How has this knowledge affected your life? How do you think it will help your success in the future?

---

In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what t

What Are the Most Important Things Students Should Learn in School?

In your opinion, what are the most important things students should learn in school? What is the most important thing you have learned in school? How has this knowledge affected your life? How do you think it will help your success in the future?

---

In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, scui

What Are the Most Important Things Students Should Learn in School?

In your opinion, what are the most important things students should learn in school? What is the most important thing you have learned in school? How has this knowledge affected your life? How do you think it will help your success in the future?

---

In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, scuience fiction, whodunits or fashi

In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, science fiction, whodunits or fashion magazines.

In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, science fiction, whodunits or fashion magazines.

What Are the Most Important Things Students Should Learn in School?

In your opinion, what are the most important things students should learn in school? What is the most important thing you have learned in school? How has this knowledge affected your life? How do you think it will help your success in the future?

---

In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, science fiction, whodunits or fashion magazines.

Schools need to develop the habit of reading, neve rmind its object.

In your opinion, what are the most important things students should learn in school? What is the most important thing you have learned in school? How has this knowledge affected your life? How do you think it will help your success in the future?

---

In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, science fiction, whodunits or fashion magazines.

Graduatinmg students need to learn that when the

Schools need to develop the habit of reading, never mind its object.

In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, science fiction, whodunits or fashion magazines.

Graduatinmg students need to learn that when they are bored, or have a pr

Schools need to develop the habit of reading, never mind its object.

The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, science fiction, whodunits or fashion magazines.

Graduatinmg students need to learn that when they are bored, or have a problem, or want to learn 

Schools need to develop the habit of reading, never mind its object.

What Are the Most Important Things Students Should Learn in School?

In your opinion, what are the most important things students should learn in school? What is the most important thing you have learned in school? How has this knowledge affected your life? How do you think it will help your success in the future?

The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, science fiction, whodunits or fashion magazines.

Graduatinmg students need to learn that when they are bored, or have a problem, or want to learn about something, the way

Schools need to develop the habit of reading, never mind its object.

What Are the Most Important Things Students Should Learn in School?

In your opinion, what are the most important things students should learn in school? What is the most important thing you have learned in school? How has this knowledge affected your life? How do you think it will help your success in the future?

In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, science fiction, whodunits or fashion magazines. And never 

Graduatinmg students need to learn that when they are bored, or have a problem, or want to learn about something, the way to do thart

Schools need to develop the habit of reading, never mind its object.

In your opinion, what are the most important things students should learn in school? What is the most important thing you have learned in school? How has this knowledge affected your life? How do you think it will help your success in the future?

---

In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, science fiction, whodunits or fashion magazines. And never mind if it is on a scre

Graduatinmg students need to learn that when they are bored, or have a problem, or want to learn about something, the way to do thart

Schools need to develop the habit of reading, never mind its object.

Graduating students need to learn that when they are bored, or have a problem, or want to learn about something, the way to do that is 

Schools need to develop the habit of reading, never mind its object.

In your opinion, what are the most important things students should learn in school? What is the most important thing you have learned in school? How has this knowledge affected your life? How do you think it will help your success in the future?

In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, science fiction, whodunits or fashion magazines. And never mind if it is on a screen or on a page.

The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, science fiction, whodunits or fashion magazines. And never mind if it is on a screen or on a page.

Schools need to develop the habit of reading, never mind its object. Graduating students need to learn that when they are bored, or have a problem, or want to learn about something, the way to do that is to read about it.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, science fiction, whodunits or fashion magazines. And never mind if it is on a screen or on a page.

Schools need to develop the habit of reading, never mind its object. Graduating students need to learn that when they are bored, or have a problem, or want to learn about something, the way to do that is to read about it.

A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, science fiction, whodunits or fashion magazines. And never mind if it is on a screen or on a page.

Schools need to develop the habit of reading, never mind its object. Graduating students need to learn that when they are bored, or have a problem, or want to learn about something, the way to do that is to read about it.

Schools need to develop the habit of reading, never mind its object. Graduating students need to learn that when they are bored, or have a problem, or want to learn about something, the way to do that is to read about it.

Once a student has that habit, the whiole workld is theirs amd a lifetime of l

What Are the Most Important Things Students Should Learn in School?

In your opinion, what are the most important things students should learn in school? What is the most important thing you have learned in school? How has this knowledge affected your life? How do you think it will help your success in the future?

---

In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, science fiction, whodunits or fashion magazines. And never mind if it is on a screen or on a page.

Schools need to develop the habit of reading, never mind its object. Graduating students need to learn that when they are bored, or have a problem, or want to learn about something, the way to do that is to read about it.

Once a student has that habit, the whiole workld is theirs amd a lifetime of le

Schools need to develop the habit of reading, never mind its object. Graduating students need to learn that when they are bored, or have a problem, or want to learn about something, the way to do that is to read about it.

Once a student has that habit, the whole world is theirs amd a lifetime of learning vcan begib.

What Are the Most Important Things Students Should Learn in School?

In your opinion, what are the most important things students should learn in school? What is the most important thing you have learned in school? How has this knowledge affected your life? How do you think it will help your success in the future?

---

In my opinion, the most important thing a student can learn in school, is a love of books and reading. Most curricula that teach reading use texts that are formal, constrained and infinitely boring. The books are written in a way that makes it difficult for the student to understand what is being said because what it contains have little to do with the students' world.

Teachers need to evaluate that world and acquire texts that describe and celebrate it. The students will then be able to read and understand what they are reading. A girl in East Harlem can read magazines and books that celebrate black and brown culture and heritage. A boy in Kansas can read books about farming, mechanics or outer space--whatever interests them.

Teaching reading using a canon of approves texts is like teach a toddler how to eat by giving them spinach and raw carrots: it may work, but does not ignite either the passions or the imagination.  Students need to be allowed to read what they want, be it comic books, science fiction, whodunits or fashion magazines. And never mind if it is on a screen or on a page.

Schools need to develop the habit of reading, never mind its object. Graduating students need to learn that when they are bored, or have a problem, or want to learn about something, the way to do that is to read about it.

Once a student has that habit, the whole world is theirs and a lifetime of learning vcan begib.
